intro: Cnestis mullendersii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it an intriguing subject for both botanists and nocturnal pollinators.
